title: Bitcoin Dips Under $42,000 as Market Sentiment Turns Neutral Post-ETF
description: Bitcoin briefly dropped below $42,000 Monday morning, as the Crypto Fear & Greed Index turned neutral for the first time since November 2023.

title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

An Argentine landlord signed an agreement with their tenant for rent payments in Bitcoin (BTC). Investment giant BlackRock has launched an advertising campaign for its newly listed spot Bitcoin ETF, with some suggesting it could finally entice the “wealthy boomer” market. Meanwhile, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler has admitted that Grayscale's legal victory against the regulator laid the groundwork for the eventual approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs.

In Rosario, the third most populated city in Argentina, a local landlord and a tenant have sealed a rental agreement where the latter will pay monthly rent in Bitcoin (BTC). According to a local report, the contract is the first of its kind in Argentina, made possible by recent law amendments by the new presidential administration.

Argentine rental law, along with other parts of the national legal system were amended by the newly-elected President Javier Milei.

Read more

title: Crypto Fear and Greed Index Turns “Neutral” Following Spot Bitcoin (BTC) ETF Approvals
description: Crypto market sentiment has turned “neutral” for the first time since October 2023. According to the ‘Crypto Fear and Greed Index,” sentiments turned “neutral” following almost three months in the “greed” phase.

title: Tether (USDT) Emerges as Go-to Currency for Scammers, UN Warns of Growing Threat
description:
